f37c83a : Adds support for the library_dirs key, which appears in the documentation but was never actually implemented. library_dirs is essentially equivalent to adding "-Lfoo" to ldflags in Make, modifying LIBRARY_SEARCH_PATHS in Xcode, or adding AdditionalLibraryPaths to the VCLinkerTool or VCLibrarianTool in MSVS. I have attempted to make an analogous change to the ninja generator, but have not been able to test it (ninja was not in the tree I checked out) and I am fairly sure it's wrong. Guidance here would be appreciated.

13060de : I found that msvs_settings/VCLibrarianTool/LinkTimeCodeGeneration is not supported by Ninja. As a result, you will see a warning message: "foo.obj : MSIL .netmodule or module compiled with /GL found; restarting link with /LTCG; add /LTCG to the link command line to improve linker performance" when you build a static_library target with /GL option.

b0e7c03 : Ensure GYP_PARALLEL prints error messages. Errors sent to stdout were being swallowed by gclient runhooks; moved them to stderr. Also added an informational message when there's an error, and made it so that GYP_PARALLEL=0 disables parallel processing. Review URL: https://codereview.appspot.com/7000046/
9717f51 : Define replacement rules for $(VSInstallDir) and $(VCInstallDir) when and only when Visual Studio is actually installed. This is because these locations may not be valid when we are using custom build tool chains under hermitic build environment. Without this condition, os.path.join(self.vs_version.Path(),'VC') fails as an invalid operation. Review URL: https://codereview.chromium.org/11570021

6b4f0fe : Xcode: Fix build failure when linking to an external static library whose path is not relative. Static libraries (i.e., .a files) are translated into a -l<name> flag, so a corresponding -L is needed no matter what the format of the path is.

0a3a28f : Switching off external makefile (which requires cygwin on windows). This enables this test to pass for win32 and win64.
beef34e : Disabling failing scons tests so we notice regressions.
4fcdd88 : Tolerate an empty set of configurations by falling back to generate a Default configuration. input.py handles this by allays offering a Default configuration even if the .gyp file didn't specify any, but in a .gyp file that offers no targets, there's no way for this to make it to the project scope. xcode.py normally builds a configuration list at the project scope based on all of the configuration names in all of the targets in an .xcodeproj. Adding this check protects against that list being empty because no targets are present. Review URL: http://codereview.chromium.org/6516006

67e7daf : Fix compilation problem where on full compiles, setup_exe_version.rc would not be generated. This bug was introduced in r875.
5280d28 : make: test for ar's "T" flag at gyp time
f078f34 : make generator: refactor shared headers together
07cf2eb : Back out GYP trunk r880. It's broken.
26d2ce0 : The new postbuild step in Chromium's third_party/WebKit/Source/WebCore/WebCore.gyp/WebCore.gyp:webcore_svg is running before libwebcore_svg.a exists in clobber debug builds. Explicitly declaring a target's intended output (linkable or static library) as an input to the postbuild shell script action forces the postbuild to wait for the link step to complete. Because no outputs are declared, the postbuild step will still run each time the target is built, which is the desired behavior.

cc59ba2 : Add a flag to generate the Makefile in a different directory than --depth. This allows us to properly generate a Makefile in an upstream checkout where we want to have the Makefile in the root checkout, but we want <(DEPTH) to be at WebKit/chromium because that's where gclient pulls our dependencies.
a89bf86 : Err not quite the right fix.
1c6d6a8 : When looking for the .gyp folder under your home directory, we were taking the first folder that existed in home_vars and assuming it would contain .gyp. If it didn't we would never check the other folders. This means on Windows if you set your HOME directory to something other than %USERPROFILE% then the include file for gyp goes missing. This caused my VS2005 to stop building multi core.

65f9b50 : Make generator: write a more efficient version of fixup_dep that is O(1) instead of O(n) for the number of exec()s, with n = number of dependencies. All those calls to xargs -n1 printf is slowing the build down because calls to fixup_dep is taking up a make job slot that would otherwise go towards g++.

366c664 : Currently we force the tests to run in serial by repeating the invoke of the unittest command in the Run All Tests target and again in the All:Run All Tests. This removes that and adds an xcode generator flag that forces test to run in serial. Create new .built_file_{must,must_not}_{exist,match}() methods in the base class that use the subclass-specific .built_file_path() methods. Get rid of the .built_lib_{must,must_not}_exist() methods in favor of calling .built_file_{must,must_not}_exist() with type=test.STATIC_LIB. 9def40c : This changes variable expansion so that it is recursive. For instance, now you can write <(foo <(bar)) and it will work correctly. I added a debugging switch for gyp so that we can start it with different debugging modes to get different output. Right now it just has "general" and "variables", but others can easily be added (it just checks to see what's in the gyp.debug set). Call gyp.DebugOutput. Also added a very rudimentary testing script. It doesn't use gtest or anything fancy, it just runs a test for variable expansions with debugging output, and verifies that the debugging output matches the golden files. It uses gypd output to verify that everything was parsed correctly.

170641c : Latest round of SCons generator changes: * Make sure rules, too, are built before the actual targets. * Generate a 'gyp_target_*' Alias for each target that corresponds to the XCode-like gyp targets. * Express explicit order-only prerequisites between dependent gyp_target_* Aliases to conform to gyp build order requirements. * Stop trying to be smart about only creating the 'prerequisites' variable in the *.scons files when it's "necessary." It's much simpler to just create an empty list, extend it as necessary, and let SCons sort out the behavior. * Refactor the _SCons_*_writer() functions a bit to commonize more code. 214178a : Lift restriction on "sources" in "none" type targets. It should be permissible to have sources that are inputs to rules, provided that there is nothing actually compileable and that nothing in a "none" type target would try to produce a product such as a library or executable.

566665e : Another drop of Makefile work.
6808116 : Remove comment obsolete since r46.
e361249 : Fix grit invocation after Chromium r10306. grit now puts its generated headers in a grit directory on its own and does not need to be told to use a grit directory. The grit rule and action in net.gyp may need to be modified as well.
0af45e0 : More incremental improvement on the msvs generator. Some changes to the python scripts, to avoid stray \r on windows.
025aeb6 : Remove limitations on listing cached included files in generated included_files sections.

e693f02 : Get webkit building (almost) on Linux with gyp-generated *.scons files:
ab3a0dd : Allow for "var%", which sets variable "var" only if it is not already set. Make .gyp samples declare whether they're external or not by setting the "chromium_code" variable to 1 if they are. common.gypi sets "chromium_code%" to 0 so that external .gyps have a value for this variable. common.gypi then includes external_code.gypi if chromium_code is 0. This is now done in preference to requiring externals to include external_code.gypi. In conjunction with --include, this enables settings to be pushed from external_code.gypi into externally-maintained .gyp files without their having to include anything.
d9b6344 : Drop icudt38l_dat_linux.s sample now that it's part of the Chromium tree as of r10305.
fc56f61 : Un-exclude browser/bookmarks/bookmark_drag_data.cc for Chromium r10300.
07080ba : webkit.gyp: Add files from Chromium r10283, which merged WebKit r41181. chrome.gyp: Add ported file from r10293.
76977ee : Put file references to .gyp and .gypi files into a "Build" child group of the main group.
2bafdca : Put included_files into each build file's dict to indicate what files were included to contribute to the dict. In the Xcode generator, put these files into the main group where they can be easily accessed.
676305c : Replace depth with DEPTH, a gyp-predefined variable. DEPTH will always be set to a relative path from a .gyp file's directory to the directory given in the --depth argument. As a special case, to aid in bootstrapping Chromium and to preserve existing usage, gyp will use a "src" directory in the path to a .gyp file as the default for the --depth argument.
eeccd9e : Make RelativePath work when both path arguments are identical.
e1c13c1 : Add a few new and previously-excluded files to chrome.gyp.
3fde248 : Support wildcard dependencies of the form build_file:*. Add all.gyp, which has a single "all" target that depends on everything else using this scheme.
d341269 : Factor BuildTargetsDict and QualifyDependencies out into their own functions instead of performing these actions as parts of Load and BuildDependencyList.

This should be changed to use a generator-provided function that can be (or wrap) EncodePOSIXShellList for POSIXish generators and does something Windows-specific for the MSVS generator, but this will do for now since the MSVS generator is temporarily using EncodePOSIXShellList anyway.

d7c127e : r269 brings the product_name keyword and sets product_name for some libraries to the names they usually use. This takes care of the problem of the extra "lib" in library names, like "liblibevent.a". Generator support required; this works for the Xcode generator now and will not harm other generators that are not yet aware of product_name.
5505a8b : Get rid of mac_localized_bundle_resources in favor of listing localized resources directly in mac_localized_resources. Localized resources are chosen by examining pathnames; files in ".lproj" directories are assumed to be localized and are placed in an appropriate PBXVariantGroup for localization.

cb6f53f : - Allow make_names and makeprop output files to be in different directories. HTMLNames.h and CSSPropertyNames.h need to go into SHARED_INTERMEDIATE_DIR so that other targets see them. - Enable 4 disabled tests in test_shell_tests blocked by the above. - Eliminate ensure_dirs. Environments should always ensure that output directories for rules and actions exist; if they don't do this automatically, the generator should write it into the action. - Change how some targets include the "src" directory - this is now done more by direct_dependent_settings than before. Some missing dependency links are added.

eed58be : Adding rules file generation support for windows. Got some rules working....
a525822 : Got some of the common scripts working under windows.
937c5e2 : Add some comments I meant to write for r212.
cdee32a : Get rid of the three identical js2c actions in different targets in v8.gyp in favor of a single js2c action in a js2c "none"-type target that others can depend on. This is enabled by the new rule that INTERMEDIATE_DIR is scoped at least to an entire .gyp file (r182, r207), so the outputs of the js2c action are now available to other targets in the same file by referencing their locations in INTERMEDIATE_DIR.
6105598 : Rule support updates: - Make Xcode rules more robust. Due to Xcode bugs (filed and identified in comments), rules are now handled by make. - Eliminate badly-specified "*" from rules. Instead, use the new RULE_INPUT_* variables. - Update WebKit sample to take advantage of process_outputs_as_sources, avoiding the need to list rule outputs distinctly as compilation inputs.
581bb7d : Fix backslash escaping in Xcode output. Checkpoint an exploratory attempt to work around Xcode rule handling deficiencies - this approach will be abandoned but it's good to get the progress in source history.
7d90ffc : Check for ID collisions in the Xcode generator.
d6bcc36 : Ensure uniqueness of PBXBuildFile object IDs. Formerly, there would be collisions when two PBXBuildFiles referred to different PBXFileReferences identifying files with the same name in different directories, or when two PBXBuildFiles referred to different PBXReferenceProxies identifying target products with the same name in different remote project files. It should now be impossible for PBXBuildFile IDs to collide unless the same file is added to the same build phase more than once - this should be considered illegal anyway.
63f9810 : Properly specify default configuration when none are explicitly provided.
4ab0292 : In Xcode, split up Debug and Release intermediates.
9f96d9f : Bring up the rest of v8_bindings, including all of the non-generated files.

d574e0b : Ensure persistence of XCHierarchicalElement hashes even after the results of TakeOverOnlyChild change due to input changes.
7ed07f9 : When generating Xcode project files, collapse groups with single group children into single groups.
b352c6b : Fix a bug dealing with relative path references to remote project files in the Xcode generator. Canonicalize supplied input build file paths in the input module, fixing bugs with invocations like "gyp ./net.gyp" as opposed to "gyp net.gyp".
6eb312d : r200, making progress!
20db697 : Allow project file-wide Xcode build settings. This is only intended to be used in very specific cases identified in the comment. Please don't use this arbitrarily. All build settings really belong in target or configuration scope (target_defaults and other sections merged into targets are OK).

0ef6d00 : Adding support for 'defines' pairs. Adding precompiled headers to wtf.
b6d4a03 : Initial rules section support.
2dacd5c : Fixing up precompiled header handling on windows.
729bcdd : Update webkit.gyp:wtf to better reflect current reality, and to be more cross-platform.
f91862a : Change formatting of the name of action script phases emitted by the Xcode generator. Add a TODO recommending the replacement of subprocess.list2cmdline in ExpandVariables' string-context list expansion code.
b01958e : Rewrite exclude and regex rule processing to be substantially simpler and better. Processing now builds a parallel list of actions, and defers deletion and building whatever_excluded lists until all excludes and includes have been seen and the action list fully constructed. This has the advantage that items that are excluded and subsequently included retain their original position in the list, instead of being removed and re-appended. Remove a workaround for this former limitation from the v8 sample.
839c161 : v8.gyp: use _inputs and _outputs automatic variables in action section when running mksnapshot.
bad551c : Use all available bits from the hash when computing Xcode project file IDs by XORing extra bits above the 96 that Xcode uses into the ID.
48a1592 : Adding WTF, after a fashion.
61ddd97 : Minor performance improvement in Xcode generator: evaluate unchanging condition only once.
82030a4 : Improve Xcode generator hashing slightly by using struct.pack to get the length hashable insead of the custom masks and shifts that accomplished the same thing more slowly. Clean up some of the remaining TODOs.
2d7df9e : r169 provides a 25% performance improvement in the Xcode generator. Profiling indicated that PBXGroup.AddOrGetFileByPath was a major hotspot. A dict is added to that class to track child objects by path rather than performing a linear search through all children.
ffd125c : Set svn:eol-style on some .gyp files.
2c57244 : Be really careful about how Xcode project files are replaced. Stage new project file contents in a temporary file, compare it to any existing file, and only replace it if the new one is different. This avoids potentially- problematic Xcode project file reloads for no-change updates and definitely- problematic Xcode reloads of incomplete project files.
166455c : Adding webkit_resources.

1f3179f : It is now possible to have list variables and to expand them in list context or string context. List context list expansions use the same @ form introduced last week. String context list expansions cause the list to be joined in a shell-compatible way by subprocess.list2cmdline.

ecd6123 : msvs generator now adds excluded files as disabled to the source tree. msvs generator can now handle most of the settings in the vsprops files. Missing items include: precompiled headers not completely right Macros not handled correctly. Rules not handled correctly.
32c37d4 : Make ! and / rule processing recursive so that -Wall can be excluded with a ! rule by external_code.gypi. Turn -Werror on for the Mac build, and disable it along with -Wall for external code.
37964e1 : Include an "All" aggregate target as the first target in an Xcode project file when the project file contains more than one other target. This ensures that when a project file is opened and built for the first time, everything in it will be built.
3f92826 : Improve Xcode generator module performance by another 10% by further optimizing string encoding to take better advantage of regular expressions.

6e76125 : Fix RE from r122.
3abfc97 : Xcode generator improvements: - 20% performance improvement in Xcode generator. Profiling showed much time spent in XCObject._EncodeString and StringContainsOnly. The frequently-called string matching operation is replaced by a precompiled regular expression. - Fixed a bug causing IDs to shift depending on how many project files were being built, and in what order. The hash object was being reused instead of getting a new one for each PBXProject.
bf684dd : Don't reload include files that have already been loaded once already.

Sort all top-level groups into group (folder/directory) and file sections, and sort alphabetically within. Sort each project's main group in a known order, and alphabetically thereafter. Clean a few things up by making a couple of hacks less hacky.

c842e2d : Add specific settings for Debug/Release modes.
85388cd : Get base_unittests building and running under .gyp: * Update our generation function for the new 'configurations' list. * For now, just use the first configuration in the list (Debug) to generate the build information. This gets things working until we update the Chromium SCons infrastructure (build/SConscript.main) to mesh with gyp-generated configurations. * Handle a new 'cflags' configuration setting. * Change the default generated file name to *_gyp.scons.
c47b92f : On Linux, clients compiling with icu38 currently set U_STATIC_IMPLEMENTATION.
407804e : Add support for xcode_settings. Change the order of include phase processing relative to early conditional phase processing to get the expected behavior. Remove USE_HEADERMAP hack. Update samples.
35d23de : Support for configurations within targets. - "configurations" sections are now permitted within target dicts. Most target settings are merged into "configurations" sections prior to late/post/target conditional and variable expansion processing and exclude list and rules processing. - Samples are updated to include build/common.gypi, which defines Debug and Release configurations globally. - The Xcode generator is updated to handle "configurations" sections. The gypd generator requires no update. The msvs, scons, and make generators have not been updated. This is an interface-breaking change, other generator authors have been notified. - "name" in target sections is changed to "target_name". Samples and generators are updated.
9353fde : Allow "samples" to be run from anywhere
b2dfeaf : Took out Website.... thing.
3adee93 : Fixing handling of windows drive letters c:/xyz.
fab70d3 : Switching visual studio projects to relative paths.
ad56f45 : Only emit Command lines for prebuild/postbuild when there is one.
5702888 : Switching copy scripts to python (so they work on non-cygwin windows for nick). Single utility with 2 command lines: samples push PATH_TO_CHROME samples pull PATH_TO_CHROME
159ff5b : Allow include files to be injected into target .gyp files by specifying them on the command line.
039b97f : Make targets inherit from a target dict's root "target_defaults" (formerly "settings") key properly. Each target is merged into a copy of target_defaults now rather than the other way around, because targets should be thought of as inheriting from (and overriding) the defaults. The target_defaults merge phase is now done immediately between include processing and "pre"/"early" variable expansion and conditional evaluation.
97d85aa : Capture initial work at generating both SConscript files and Makefiles.
d94ee48 : Add shared library build support to the Xcode generator. Fix a link dependency collection bug in the input module that this feature uncovered.
790651f : Temporarily generate xcodeproj bundles with _gyp in the name to avoid colliding with checked-in xcodeprojs. Inspired by the msvs generator.
f6d65a9 : Source code reorganization. Move most input-specific functionality into gyp.input. Move functions useful for both input and output into gyp.common. Rename the xcodeproj generator to xcode.
7bf9d8b : - Refactor static library dependency adjustment phase. - Make resultant dependency ordering more consistent and in line with expectations. - Rewritten using LinkDependencies. - Remove DependencyGraphNode.*Dependents methods, now unused and deprecated in favor of *Dependencies methods. - In the Xcode generator, add "libraries" to the link phase after "dependencies."
2cb9c60 : Adding security tests, issues with SolutionDir need to still be resolved. Added shared_library type.
78633bd : Fixing indenting.
74b2d4e : Redo *_dependent_settings and link_settings merging to loop over dependencies, not dependents. This should result in a more predictable and expected ordering.
7bda99c : Refactor dependent_settings into direct_dependent_settings, with the same semantics as the old dependent_settings. Add all_dependent_settings, which is fully transitive. Add link_settings, which merges settings into dependents that actually perform a link step.
23b3f3e : Fixing lint warnings.
d3af177 : Fix a bug in the input reader: "variables" sections should not be unhooked during variable expansion and conditional evaluation, they need to stay in the dict tree so that they're still there for late processing. The included_list during exclude and regular expression rule parsing doesn't need to be in the dict tree at all. Also, set svn:eol-style = LF on some new files.
354fd9b : Add libjpeg.gyp to samples.sh. (Seems to have been overlooked.)
0d34720 : Got net_unittests building and running on windows.
b626691 : Adding in modp_b64.
f0e2a15 : Adding .gyp files to the generated projects (to allow them to be edited).
6e4febd : Added support disabling visual studio warnings. Disabled several warnings in base. These were originally disabled in base.vcproj for 3 particular files. While working on gyp these had been disabled in my local client by modifying base.vsprops. This change eliminates the need for a change to base.vsprops.
1d4bf03 : r69 provides real conditional expression evaluation support, via Python eval(). - variables_hack is removed and replaced by eval() of supplied expressions bound to the same real variables used for variable expansion. - The input module and generators can provide default values for variables. Recommend naming these predefined variables with CAPITAL_LETTERS to avoid collisions. - Add support for setting variables on the command line. - Updated samples slightly for compatibility with the expression language and to test conditional "else" support.
161b360 : Improve variable expansion and condition evaluation phases. They are now performed simultaneously, and as a bonus, target_conditions sections are now meaningful. Nested condition sections now work. Variables are properly reloaded after performing operations that may result in their being changed. Within a single dict scope, string value variable expansions are now done first, and then condition sections are processed. Recursion into child list and dict values is only done after these steps.
68eaa37 : Add object_watcher.cc to base sources! (exclude) list on non-Windows.
b88a4d3 : Adding in net_unittests and many (but not all of its dependencies). It gets to the link, but is missing a few things on windows.
bc59849 : Support additional list merge policies. In addition to the already-supported append (no suffix), these new policies are now available: prepend ("+"), replace ("="), and set-if-not-present ("?").
b8bfc74 : Dll copying now working.
d608a52 : Put source files into folder hierarchy under each project (instead of flat list).
1b6cfc4 : Initial variable expansion support.
8f086e2 : Add generalized rule processing, replacing source_excludes and source_patterns with "!" and "/" suffixes, respectively, that can appear as keys of any list immediately within a target. Implement the proposed _excluded auto-generated list so that generators can add excluded files to project files but keep them excluded from compilation phases. Implement regex include rules, which can prevent items from being excluded or can resurrect them from prior exclusion.
f659a89 : Now able to link unit tests. Some fail, missing copy step.
5e4b07b : Closer on vs build working.
c35392f : Explicitly close file objects when done. This isn't C++ and destructors don't run as soon as objects go out of scope.
57caca1 : Adding a new gypd output generator module, which outputs .gypd files (the "d" stands for "debug") from .gyp input after all merging, conditional evaluation, dependency adjustments, etc. is performed.
6360f52 : Fixed some of the cygwin/windows pathing weirdness.
e6c0458 : Keep all source files in "sources" sections, and in "conditions" sections, use "source_excludes" in preference to "sources". This approach has the advantage that generators will be able to access lists of excluded files and add them to projects with compilation suppressed.
f3c29f2 : Completely replaced the topological sort procedure for dependency graphs. The old one probably had problems flattening complex graphs.
f0608af : Taking out incorrectly specified dependencies.
960cf75 : Adding more windowisms to gyp samples. Removing erroneous 'depends' section.
5a40729 : Adding in transitive dependent projects.
4700a45 : Adding batch file to run from windows active python. Currently only works if input gyp path is relative.
610f8dc : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 23:00 - Fix an expected relative path bug confirmed by new skia.gyp. - Add trial source_excludes exercised by new skia.gyp. - Update xcodeproj generator to not add .h files to compile-sources phases. - Update samples: - Add skia.gyp. - Add base_gfx to base.gyp and its unit test files to base_unittests. - Remove probably-unneeded .. and, where needed, . dirs from some samples.
efc584a : Fixed up path handled in generator.
7192f76 : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 20:15 - #!/bin/sh, not #!/usr/bin/bash. - Set some svn properties on new files.
03a7d37 : Actually got the generator going now, sort of. Several issues: 1. cygwin paths 2. not populating the solutions with all the projects needed 3. have not integrated the changes needed in base.gyp
00f9005 : Ooops, /bin/bash, not /usr/bin/bash
bf71f62 : Adding scripts to copy to and from samples. Adding windows tweak to icu38.
24fa69a : Adding in sample gyp files needed for windows.
7bf531d : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 17:59 - Add xcode_framework_dirs. - Fix a relative path interpretation bug.
8c8c673 : Adding in visual studio project generator. Adding stub for msvs generator.
66bae89 : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 17:21 - I meant msvs, not msvc.
81f836d : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 17:19 - Provide default generator name (msvc) for win32 and cygwin. - Make conditional evaluation slightly less cheesy, but still pretty cheesy, by changing the hard-coded string to a hard-coded list that the generator can influence.
5278366 : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 16:43 - Update sample files to reflect agreed-upon style: - Standardize on 'single-quoting' instead of "double-quoting" strings. - Put commas at the ends of lists.
892ac19 : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 16:34 - Commit current wrapper.
42ca7d0 : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 16:13 - Clean up static library dependency adjustments.
201f4a8 : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 15:42 - Allow "includes" sections within a list: - They're still only functional within a dict context, but the dict can now be in a list. - Required for "includes" sections within targets now that targets are lists. - Improve conditional processing: - Much-needed internal cleanup. - "Pre"/"early" is still the only conditional type supported. - Still hard-coded. - Add path normalization to avoid ../third_party/../third_party. - Make source_patterns processing happen later, so that it can be influenced by dependent_settings.
7868141 : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 14:40 - Change "targets" from a dict to a list. - Check in sample input files.
22bf547 : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 14:18 - Mass conversion of quoting style from "..." to '...'
cda52cc : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 13:31 - Restore "includes" and refactor build file loading.
16f6633 : Checkpoint 2009-01-29 12:34 - Use eval instead of a JSON lib to parse input. Please don't put arbitrary Python constructs into build files. - Eliminate required arguments: - Allow a platform-specific default for -f (format). - Find build files in the current directory if none are specified.

3a6061e : Fixed an assertion in the new compiler to take stack overflow exceptions into account.
7be3c99 : Improved code generation infrastructure by doing simple register allocation and constant folding and propagation.
59bd737 : Push revision 1457 from bleeding_edge to trunk.

061ef74 : Optimized double-to-integer conversions in bit operations by using SSE3 instructions if available.
a770a89 : Merge revision 1367 from bleeding edge to trunk to fix xcode project files.
381abbb : Improved profiling support by performing simple call stack sampling for ticks and by fixing a bug in the logging of code addresses.
6f10e41 : Fixed two crash-bugs in irregexp (issue 231 and 233).
245aa85 : Fixed crash-bug in the code generation for case independent 16 bit backreferences.
987f25d : Forgot to update version number.
a8d58b8 : Push bleeding_edge revision 1199 to trunk. Fixes chromium issue 7258.
f2748c8 : Fix to visual studio dependencies in connection to snapshot generation.
7ffe94f : Pushing change to maximum RegExp backtracking stack. Updating to version 0.4.9.1.
ddb913d : Enabled new regular expression engine.
715915b : Minor patch to debugger support.
3291210 : Fixed string length bug on ARM (issue 171).
aca4968 : Fixed xcode build
37abdec : Minor bugfixes and optimizations.
8bb6058 : Fixed exception reporting bug where certain exceptions were incorrectly reported as uncaught.
a74f0da : Added experimental API support for allocating V8 symbols as external strings.
96f667e : Added the v8::jscre namespace around the jscre functions to avoid link errors (duplicate symbols) when building Google Chrome.
3bf7b91 : Reduced code size by using shorter instruction encoding when possible.
c3e50d8 : Push string shape fixes to trunk (version 0.4.3.1). Review URL: http://codereview.chromium.org/9181
870a0b6 : Added support for API accessors that prohibit overwriting by accessors defined in JavaScript code by using __defineGetter__ and __defineSetter__.
5887095 : Merge r659 from bleeding_edge to trunk (version 0.4.2.1).
9bbf968 : Improved performance of Array.prototype.concat by moving the implementation to C++ (issue 123).
9fe21c6 : Added caching of RegExp data in compilation cache.
5a8ca6c : Split the global object into two parts: The state holding global object and the global object proxy.
7ee65c9 : Push fix for issue 1439135 to trunk as V8 version 0.3.5.2. Review URL: http://codereview.chromium.org/7810
bdf2f94 : Apply fix for issue 116 from bleeding_edge branch. Update version 0.3.5 to 0.3.5.1.
7c537e2 : Improved string hash-code distribution by excluding bit-field bits from the hash-code.
1accd57 : Apply fix for issue 109 from bleeding_edge branch. Update version from 0.3.4 to 0.3.4.1. Review URL: http://codereview.chromium.org/6529
41044eb : Changed Array.prototype.sort to use quick sort.
236ad96 : Improved handling of relocation information to enable more peep-hole optimizations.
b912362 : Generalized the EvalCache into a CompilationCache and enabled it for scripts too. The current strategy is to retire all entries whenever a mark-sweep collection is started.
9258b6b : Fixed a number of build issues.
fcf516f : Reverted accidental commit to trunk. Stupid stupid stupid stupid.
881f840 : - Added api function to convert a string to utf-8.
c27e4e7 : Added support for running tests on the ARM simulator.
727e995 : Renamed the top level directory 'public' to 'include'.
4de9671 : Reverted unsafe change to code generator.
9a4089a : Included mjsunit JavaScript test suite and C++ unit tests.
cbaa060 : Improved performance of garbage collection by moving the function that updates pointers during compacting collection into the updating visitor. This gives the compiler a better chance to inline and avoid a function call per (potential) pointer.
31e7138 : Improved performance of garbage collection by changing the way we use the marking stack in the event of stack overflow during full garbage collection and by changing the way we mark roots.
51869ec : Accidentally removed svn:eol-style native from all files. Adding it back.
769cc96 : Improved performance of unary addition by avoiding runtime calls.
7276f14 : Changed all text files to have native svn:eol-style.
af4734f : Added support for storing JavaScript stack traces in a stack allocated buffer to make it visible in shallow core dumps. Controlled by the --preallocate-message-memory flag which is disabled by default.
4451067 : Fixed bug in JSObject::GetPropertyAttributePostInterceptor where map transitions would count as properties.
212ac23 : Fixed building on Mac OS X by recognizing i386 and friends as IA-32 platforms.
bd3ec4e : Fixed bug in stack overflow check code for IA-32 targets where a non-tagged value in register eax was pushed to the stack.
10ac170 : Added dtoa license file which had been left out of the initial commit.
43d26ec : Initial export.
33f2fb0 : Initial directory structure.
